page.title: 15Religion in Leicester
page.content: Leicester has become a{multi-religious city in the last ten years. Initially the city absorbed easily the{orthodoxy {of Judaism}and later{Irish}and{Polish {Catholicism.}More recently, with the arrival of{immigrant peoples}from the {sub-continent of Asia,}and from{East {Africa,}the establishment of{Sikhism, {Hinduism}and the{Muslim}faith have become effective.{60%}of the population are{Christians.}Ethnically, 85% of the Christians are white and 60% of the Asian community are Hindu. Those who claim to hold no particular beliefs amount to 10.7% of the population. Among the{Minority faiths represented are the{Buddhists}and {Christian Scientists, Jehovah's {Witnesses}and the{Lutheran}faith. Of the many places of worship, there are 8 Hindu temples, 5 Evangelical and 5 Pentacostal Churches.
